image.altText: Teachers outside SA's parliament.

items.synopsis: The SA government says its latest pay offer is the "largest" ever made to the state's public school teachers — but the union says it treats them with "contempt".

title.children: Strike to go ahead after SA teachers' union rejects 'meagre' pay proposal

image.altText: Hard of hearing, expert on cochlear

items.synopsis: The number of people caught up in a cochlear implant bungle at the Women's and Children's Hospital has risen to 263, SA Health has revealed.

title.children: Dozens more people caught up in SA cochlear implant bungle

image.altText: Anthony Albanese shakes hands with Xi Jinping in front of the Chinese and Australian flags.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has invited Chinese President Xi Jinping to visit Australia during a "very successful" meeting in Beijing.

title.children: 'At a new starting point': Albanese invites Xi to Australia after historic summit in Beijing

image.altText: A crowd of people emotional as they listen to speeches at a vigil.

items.synopsis: Hundreds gathered in a park to mourn the passing of five people killed in Daylesford on Sunday.

title.children: Regional Victorian town mourns the death of five victims killed in horror crash

image.altText: Palestinians mourn relatives killed in the Israeli bombardment of the Gaza Strip.

items.synopsis: The Gaza health ministry says more than 4,100 children have been killed since October 7, as the Pentagon admits to "thousands" of civilians killed.

title.children: Palestinian death toll estimate surpasses 10,000 as Israel continues strikes on Gaza

image.altText: Men attempt to pull a girl out from beneath rubble.

items.synopsis: IDF operations in Gaza will deal a lethal blow to Hamas, but destroying the group requires long-term political and social remedies that eliminate the reasons why young men in Gaza feel a need to join, writes Mick Ryan.

title.children: Israel's military operations will deal a huge blow to Hamas. But is it even possible to completely destroy them?

image.altText: Donald Trump sits behind a laptop in a courtroom. He is frowning.

items.synopsis: Donald Trump repeatedly clashes with a New York judge during a hostile and rambling court appearance in the fraud trial that threatens the future of his real estate empire.

title.children: 'Control your client': Trump angers judge during fiery New York fraud trial testimony

image.altText: Mayor: "I'll be the first to lie in front of a bulldozer"

items.synopsis: Locals rally to "Save the Bluff" despite assurances there is no support from either local or state government for the proposed $350m Bluff marina project.

title.children: Mayor vows to be 'first one to lie in front of a bulldozer' to prevent marina project

image.altText: An older woman and man stand with their arms around each other.

items.synopsis: A Yorke Peninsula Couple have opened their garden to the public for the last time after 16 years.

title.children: Owners of hobby garden that raised $150k for charity hang up the gloves

image.altText: G Flip on the right hand side of the screen with their hair out wearing a black leather jacket, the background is out of focus

items.synopsis: When G Flip's emails to music producers went unanswered, the drummer-singer hatched a plan. They gave themselves a year to learn the ropes and make an album, and kicked off a clever campaign to make sure people paid attention.

title.children: The 'cheeky' move G Flip pulled to get record labels listening to their music

image.altText: Photo of a woman's face with a rip through the middle.

items.synopsis: Vanessa trusted her psychologist – then she married her. Three years after her death, her family want answers.

title.children: This psychologist groomed her client, then married her. Now 20 years of deception are coming undone

image.altText: Greens Senator Janet Rice holds a Palestinian flag as she walks out of the senate.

items.synopsis: Federal Greens senator Mehreen Faruqi has walked out of the Senate after labelling the Labor government as "gutless, heartless, cowards" and urging it to call for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza.

title.children: Greens stage Senate walkout in protest for Palestinians, call on government to support Israel-Gaza ceasefire

image.altText: A hand holds a remote pointed towards a large TV.

items.synopsis: Pricey entertainment subscription services are getting the chop from more Aussie households as consumers turn to free or cheaper ad-based content for entertainment, a new report reveals.

title.children: Australians are spending less on streaming services, but rising cost of living isn't the only reason why

image.altText: A newborn baby is shown lying down, with one of its feet in the foreground of the image.

items.synopsis: Blackall has had almost 20 babies born this year,  but parents have to travel more than 200 kilometres to a birthing hospital and some women are from home for up to six weeks.

title.children: In Queensland, new mums in non-birthing hospital towns are falling through the gaps

image.altText: Black and white photo of Libbi Gorr as Elle McFeast, hands wearing gloves holding chin, looking sultry at camera.

items.synopsis: Libbi Gorr shook up Australian television in the 1990s with her comic character Elle McFeast. A controversial interview saw her TV career tumble. This is how she found her way back.

title.children: A controversial interview ended Libbi Gorr's television career. But she still believes in risk

image.altText: A rally with someone holding up a big sign saying 'Justice for Cleveland Dodd'

items.synopsis: There were opportunities to save Cleveland Dodd before his death in youth detention. Yet the WA government failed to act, writes Keane Bourke. WARNING: This story discusses incidents of self-harm and the image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: Cleveland Dodd's death in detention was entirely foreseeable — yet no-one stopped it

image.altText: A barbed wire fence pictured through trees against an orange sky

items.synopsis: Despite repeated warnings and multiple opportunities to intervene, prison authorities failed to prevent 16-year-old Cleveland Dodd's death and wasted critical minutes, the ABC can reveal. WARNING: This story discusses incidents of self-harm.

title.children: There's been no clear picture about what happened to Cleveland Dodd in the notorious Unit 18 jail, until now

image.altText: A person on a small motorbike looks at the wreckage of a car as it lies in the front lawn of a home in Ashcroft in Sydney

items.synopsis: Two boys aged between 10 and 15 years old die in a car crash in Sydney's south-west, with police searching for another two people who allegedly fled the scene.

title.children: 'Absolute destruction': CCTV captures moment of fatal Sydney car crash, police searching for driver

image.altText: A colourful brain illustration imposed over parliament house.

items.synopsis: An inquiry into attention deficit and hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) has called for a national consistency in diagnosis and treatment to improve the lives of those with the condition.

title.children: ADHD inquiry calls for national prescribing rules, Greens disability minister suggestion rejected

image.altText: Israeli officials work at the scene of an incident in Jerusalem November 6, 2023

items.synopsis: A female Israeli soldier has been seriously injured in a stabbing attack in east Jerusalem. Here's how the day's events unfolded.

title.children: Israeli border police officer stabbed in East Jerusalem, Scott Morrison visits Israeli kibbutz — as it happened

image.altText: Man in green shirt holds award and stands in front of NT flag and Aboriginal flag

items.synopsis: NT Australian of the Year Blair McFarland has been acknowledged for his decades-long commitment to improving the health and lives of some of Australia's most disadvantaged youth.

title.children: NT Australian of the Year winner Blair McFarland recognised for tackling petrol-sniffing epidemic

image.altText: A photo of Donald Trump in a suit and tie, standing and pointing, next to a photo of Joe Biden in a jacket giving a thumbs up

items.synopsis: New polls show Joe Biden faces a tough road to securing another four years in the White House.

title.children: Trump leads Biden in key polls a year out from 2024 US election

image.altText: a blurred image of two people who were william tyrrell's foster parents walking on a street

items.synopsis: The foster father is facing charges of giving false or misleading evidence to the NSW Crime Commission, as the court heard new details of the investigation into William's disappearance.

title.children: Police 'don't know' what happened to William Tyrrell but foster father has been cleared, court told

image.altText: Two men standing in an underground mine shaft

items.synopsis: Australia is known for blocking Chinese investment in critical minerals companies. As the country works towards net zero, an analyst warns we may need much greater investment from our biggest trading partner.

title.children: Chinese investment is crucial to Australia's energy transition. How will it happen?

image.altText: A close up shot of a man with white hair wearing a suit.

items.synopsis: A group of high-profile whistleblowers who helped spark royal commissions and change laws write an open letter to the federal government accusing it of overseeing a broken system that leaves whistleblowers exposed to costly legal fees — and worse.

title.children: If found guilty, whistleblower David McBride faces up to 100 years in prison. His fellow whistleblowers say that's a travesty

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Li Qiang shake hands against a blue backdrop.

items.synopsis: Chinese Australians and Australian expats in China are upbeat that the long-awaited PM visit may help reverse the "headwind" the relationship has been facing.

title.children: 'Good news for many Chinese Australians': High hopes for Albanese's China visit

image.altText: Pro sufer Matahi Drollet riding a barrel in the surf.

items.synopsis: One of the most famous surf breaks in the world, Teahupo’o, will host the Paris 2024 Olympics surfing competition  but locals say construction is threatening the tiny village's marine ecosystem, and the residents' health.

title.children: Paris 2024 Olympics environmental promises come unstuck on famous Tahiti reef

image.altText: A drone and a jet flying through a clear blue sky

items.synopsis: As Israel deploys its fleet of sophisticated, expensive drones in its war against Hamas, the militant group has come armed with its own surprise: Cheap, off-the-shelf-drones rigged up to carry bombs.

title.children: Hamas is armed with a deadly surprise: Cheap Chinese drones transformed into weapons of war

image.altText: A bald man in a Hawaiian shirt standing in front of a tree.

items.synopsis: The case against a former daycare worker, accused of sexually abusing 91 children under his care, could bypass the lower court.

title.children: Case of daycare worker facing child sex abuse charges may bypass lower court through ex officio indictment

image.altText: Pilot Deborah Lawrie smiling at airport

items.synopsis: Captain Deborah Lawrie was denied a job by Reginald Ansett for being a woman. Now her name will have pride of place on a bridge that goes over Reginald Ansett Drive, and the irony has not escaped her.

title.children: Bridge named after trailblazing female pilot to pass over road honouring man who didn't want her to fly
